meanings.definition: Made less dense; refined or purified.
meanings.sent1: The rarified air at the mountain peak was hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: The rarified atmosphere of the art gallery made her feel out of place.
meanings.sent3: The rarified taste of the expensive wine was lost on the young partygoers.
meanings.sent4: Her rarified elegance shone through in every movement she made.
meanings.sent5: The rarified beauty of the rare flower left everyone in awe.

meanings.sent1: His rarified sense of honor made him stand out among his peers.
meanings.sent2: The rarified language of the poet touched the hearts of many.
meanings.sent3: The rarified manners of the old aristocrat amused the children.
meanings.sent4: Her rarified intelligence was a beacon of light in the academic world.
meanings.sent5: The rarified grace of the ballerina mesmerized the audience.

meanings.definition: To make or become less dense; to refine or purify.
meanings.sent1: The scientist rarified the gas to study its properties.
meanings.sent2: She rarified her thoughts before presenting them to the group.
meanings.sent3: The chef rarified the sauce by adding a secret ingredient.
meanings.sent4: His experiences rarified his understanding of the world.
meanings.sent5: The artist rarified the colors in the painting to create a striking contrast.
